patterns: how many courses are there in this college
responses:
Informatics College Pokhara has been in direct partnership with London Metropolitan University, 
UK to provide enviable higher education in IT and Business to students in Pokhara.
For Bachelors Degree in Information Technology we have been offering the specialization in BSc (Hons) Computing.
For Bachelors in Business Administration we have been offering the followings:

1. BBA (Marketing) with International Business 

2. BBA (Accounting & Finance) with International Business

3. BBA (International Business)

patterns: how long will be BIT or BBA course
how long will it take to complete BIT or BBA course
responses: Our college offers 3 year long BIT course and 3 and half year long BBA course.

patterns: what is the location of the college
responses: Informatics College Pokhara is located in Matepani-12, pokhara near Gandaki Hospital.

patterns: how many semesters are there in a year
how many semesters one should study in a year
responses: There are two semesters in a year.

patterns: how many months are there in a semester
how long will be a single semester
responses: The single semester will be around 4 months.

patterns: what are the student requirements for admission
responses:
Academic Level
NEB +2 overall aggregate of 2.2 CGPA (55%) or above with each subject (theory and practical) grade D+ or above, and SEE Mathematics score of C+ ( 50%) or above.
For A-Levels, a minimum of 3.5 credits and atleast a grade of D and above.

English Proficiency
English NEB XII Marks greater or equals to 60% or 2.4 GPA
For Level 4 or Year 1 BIT
Pass in General Paper or English Language or IELTS 5.5 or PTE 47/ Meeting UCAS Tariff points of 80.
For Level 4 or Year 1 BBA
Pass in General Paper or English Language or IELTS 5.5 or PTE 47/ Meeting UCAS Tariff points of 96.

patterns: how many classes will be there in a day
responses: There may be two or three classes per day. Each class will be of 1 hour and 30 minutes.

patterns: what is the teaching style of this college?
Is the teaching pattern different from other college?
responses:
Our college has different teaching patterns than other colleges of Nepal. We adopt a British teaching methodology, following the LTW techniques which stands for Lecture, Tutorial and Workshop.
You can provide us with your contact details and our counselors shall reach out to you and provide you with further details.
There are assignments which carry more weight than your written exams. The assignments have deadlines which you should not exceed if you want to get better marks.
You can message us here at any hours. But our college premises will be open from 7:00 am to 5:00 pm only.

patterns: will there be any extra curriculum activities?
does the college conducts any fun program
responses:
Yes, Of course. Our college not only provides excellent education but also encourage students to take part in different curriculum activities. The college conducts yearly programs like Sports meet, Carnival, Holi festival, and Christmas. 
 Also our college has basketball court, badminton court, table tennis, chess, carrom board and many more refreshment zones.

patterns: what facilities are provided by the college?
what are the facilities of college for students
responses: With excellent education facilities, Our College provides various other facilities like 24 hours internet, library, classes with AC, discusson room, canteen, parking space, and student service for any students queries.

patterns: What is the last date to apply for admission?
responses: The admission deadline for the upcoming semester is [insert date]. Be sure to complete your application before that date.

patterns: How can I apply for a scholarship?
responses: Yes, we offer various scholarships based on academic performance and need. You can find more information on our website or contact our admissions office for details.

patterns: Where can I stay near the college?
responses: We provide on-campus accommodation facilities for our students. If you prefer off-campus housing, we can provide information on nearby options as well.

patterns: Tell me about the faculty members
responses: Our college boasts a highly qualified and experienced faculty. We have experts in various fields who are dedicated to providing quality education to our students.

patterns: How do you help with job placement?
responses: Yes, we have a dedicated career services department that assists students with job placement, internships, and career counseling. We prepare our students for a successful future.

patterns: What clubs and organizations are available?
responses: We offer a variety of student clubs and organizations, including sports, cultural, and academic clubs. You can join these clubs to enrich your college experience.

patterns: How can I access the library?
responses: Our library is open [insert hours]. You can access it to study, borrow books, and access research materials to support your studies.

patterns: Tell me about the sports facilities
What sports can I play at the college?
responses: We have state-of-the-art sports facilities, including a gym, basketball court, and more. You can participate in various sports and stay active.

patterns: Do you have an alumni network?
How can I connect with alumni?
responses: Yes, we have a strong alumni network. You can connect with alumni for mentorship and networking opportunities to enhance your career prospects.

In our IT program, you will study subjects like:
1. Programming and Algorithms
2. Database Management
3. Web Development
4. Networking
5. Cybersecurity
6. Artificial Intelligence
7. Software Engineering, and more.

Our BBA program covers a range of subjects including:
1. Marketing
2. Accounting and Finance
3. Business Ethics
4. Management
5. International Business
6. Entrepreneurship
7. Strategic Planning, and more.

The English program covers various literature and language courses, including:
1. English Literature
2. Creative Writing
3. Linguistics
4. Poetry and Prose
5. Shakespearean Studies
6. English Grammar
7. Communication Skills, and more.

Our Mathematics program includes subjects like:
1. Calculus
2. Algebra
3. Statistics
4. Geometry
5. Differential Equations
6. Number Theory
7. Mathematical Modeling, and more.

In the Science program, you will study subjects such as:
1. Biology
2. Chemistry
3. Physics
4. Environmental Science
5. Geology
6. Astronomy
7. Research Methodology, and more.

patterns: Tell me about gender diversity at the college
Gender balance in the student body
responses: Our college is proud of its diverse student body. We strive for a balanced gender ratio, and our commitment to diversity ensures an inclusive and supportive learning environment.

responses: As of the latest data, we have 50 female students studying at our college.

patterns: What support services are available for gender diversity?
responses: We have various support services and initiatives in place to promote gender diversity and equality. These include awareness programs, counseling services, and support for LGBTQ+ students.

responses: Our college is committed to providing an inclusive and welcoming environment for students of all genders. We have policies and practices in place to ensure that everyone feels safe and respected.

patterns: What support services are available for male students?
responses: We provide various support services to ensure the well-being and success of our male students, including academic support, counseling, and career guidance.

patterns: What support services are available for female students?
responses: We offer a range of support services tailored to the needs of our female students, including mentorship programs, leadership development, and resources for personal growth.
